author: Staff Reporter
text:
TNCC chief E.V.K.S. Elangovan has demanded a clarification from Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on the controversy surrounding her high-profile Ministers O. Pannerselvam and Natham Viswanathan.

“The Chief Minister must clarify the questions that are being raised,” Mr. Elangovan stressed.

‘Alliance sealed’

Speaking to reporters here on Saturday, he said the Congress and the DMK would begin seat-sharing talks in a few days.

“The alliance between the Congress and the DMK is a done deal. This has been confirmed by the leadership of both the parties. We will begin the seat-sharing talks in a few days,” he said.

Mr. Elangovan was answering a question about the alliance since Congress leader Rahul Gandhi would not be attending the Dravidar Kazhagam’s social justice conference in Tiruchi. The alliance has been cemented, and all that remained was to discuss who got what and how many seats.

When asked to comment on the apparent soft criticism by the DMK of the murder of Dalit youth Shankar in broad daylight in Udumalpet for marrying an upper caste girl, he said that DMK was a secular party and always fought for the rights of backward classes and Dalits. “The conference is tomorrow and this issue will be discussed,” he said.

Congress and DMK would begin seat-sharing talks in a few days, says Elangovan
title: ‘CM owes clarification on row over Ministers’
